medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic abdominal pain lasting for 1 year.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began approximately 1 year ago, occurring 3 to 4 times per week, lasting for several hours and fluctuating in intensity. Large, fatty meals worsen her pain, and she experiences early satiety. Lower abdominal discomfort, constipation, and bloating are relieved by stool evacuation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Appendectomy in childhood. No chronic diseases involving heart, lungs, kidneys, skin, or endocrine system. No history of anemia, ulcers, swallowing difficulties, jaundice, or pancreatitis. Stable weight over the last year.
medical_history.family_history: Mother underwent cholecystectomy at age 39 for gallstones. Sister has irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). No family history of ulcer disease, gastrointestinal malignancies, inflammatory bowel disease, or celiac disease.
medical_history.social_history: Single, works full-time at a publishing company. Consumes 2 to 3 glasses of wine weekly and 25 to 30 g of fiber daily. Born in the United States, has never traveled outside the country.
